name: sellou with almonds
ingredients: 1.25 kg blanched almonds fried in oil (plus extra for decoration)
1.25 kg sesame seeds roasted in the oven or in a pan
1 teaspoon ground gum arabic (with a bit of powdered sugar)
1 nutmeg ground (with a bit of powdered sugar)
400 g powdered sugar (more or less to taste)
Brown butter (made from 500g of butter) or almond oil to bind
steps: Blanch and toast the almonds (in oil or in the oven). Grind some finely and chop the rest coarsely.
Roast the sesame seeds. Grind most of them finely.
Toast the flour in the oven or in a pan until golden. Let cool and sift.
In a large bowl, mix the flour, ground sesame, ground almonds, powdered sugar, cinnamon, gum arabic, and nutmeg.
Melt the butter to make brown butter (or use almond oil). Add the butter (or fat/oil) and honey (if used) to the dry mixture.
Knead thoroughly to achieve the desired texture (crumbly or more compact).
Shape into a dome or disks and decorate with almonds. Store in an airtight container.
